question: How did the AMD Data Center segment perform in Q3 2024?
ground_truth: The Data Center segment revenue reached a record $3.5 billion in Q3 2024, up 122% year-over-year, driven by strong sales of AMD Instinct GPUs and EPYC CPUs.
generated_answer:
Atomic Facts with Citations:
• AMD Data Center segment had a very strong Q3 2024 quarter overall, especially for the Instinct product portfolio [C2][C5]
• Data Center GPU revenue was approaching the size of AMD's compute business, which was around $1.7 billion [C6]
• September actuals for Data Center GPU were in the $1.5 billion range [C4]
• AMD completed important customer milestones and ramped above initial expectations in Q3 [C5]
• AMD raised full-year Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion [C5]
• The guidance increase was based on completion of customer milestones [C5]
 Final Answer:
AMD's Data Center segment delivered very strong performance in Q3 2024, particularly driven by the Instinct GPU portfolio [C2][C5]. Data Center GPU revenue approached approximately $1.5 billion, nearing the size of AMD's compute business which was around $1.7 billion [C4][C6].
The segment exceeded initial expectations as AMD completed important customer milestones and ramped production above original plans [C5]. This strong performance led AMD to raise its full-year Data Center GPU guidance by $500 million, from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion [C5].
The guidance increase was specifically attributed to the successful completion of customer milestones during the quarter [C5]. AMD expressed confidence in the trajectory through the end of 2024 based on this momentum [C5].
Specific quarterly revenue growth rates, margins, and detailed segment breakdowns were not found in provided sources.
